properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 2:41PM PST until January 24 at 8:20PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County

Rain the last 6 hours or so came in heavier than than previously
thought and will drive the Satsop River above flood stage this
afternoon. The river has crested upstream so it won't be going up
much higher but enough to exceed flood stage.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Satsop River Near Satsop
* until Friday evening.
* At  2:15 PM Thursday the stage was 37.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 38.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 4 PM
Thursday and crest near 38.8 feet around 4 AM Friday. The river
will fall below flood stage Friday late morning.
* Impact...At 38.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood low pasture lands
and some roads along the river.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
